trustfund:
TF051355-PHRD-YUGOSLAVIA: SECOND PRIVATE
            AND FINANCIAL SECTOR ADJUSTMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
This Second Private and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit (PFSAC) Project is rated satisfactory,
            with a likely sustainability, and substantial institutional
            development impacts. In particular, the project team
            recognized the need for a clean, and transparent
            privatization process, and for tailoring the reform design
            to the specific features, and economic culture of the
            country, resulting in a hard-hitting, and results-focused
            project, yet realistic reform program, as well. One of the
            main reasons this project achieved its ambitious agenda, was
            that a vast technical assistance (TA) provision supported
            the Government in implementing its program, which included
            both Bank and donor financing. The TA eased not only the
            privatizations specified by conditionalities, and by the new
            laws being drafted, but also the critical institution
            building, required to implement changes, and sustain the
            program in the long run. Other lessons reinforce the
            importance of donor coordination, of an integrated approach
            necessary to implement reforms in both the financial and
            enterprise sectors, and, for establishing a legal framework,
            while focusing on institutional capacity and enforcement.
